PRICING

Before departing on their Astrocruise™ voyage and walking among the stars, passengers must first undergo simple training to ensure that they will be able to effectively and safely participate in space travel. Passengers must complete three categories of training, which are physical conditioning, technical training, and finally, Astronaut training.

Physical Conditioning

When preparing for an Astrocruise trip, you must first be evaluated physically. A checkup from your physician and blood tests will be required from all passengers to ensure that they are healthy enough for space travel. In addition to that, new passengers will be required to participate in complementary weight and Crossfit training sessions to ensure that they will be strong and fit enough to adapt to different conditions and gravitational atmospheres.

Technical Training

Here at Astrocruise, we pride ourselves on the authenticity of our astronaut experience. Before departing for their voyage, passengers will be given a quick instructional course on how to operate all the technological equipment and machinery used on our space vessels. You will learn valuable skills such as problem-solving, scripting, and basic circuitry. If you're not a tech person, don't worry. Our course is designed for absolute beginners and can be completed by almost anyone.

Astronaut Training

Finally to complete astronaut training, passengers must train for the great spacewalk. They must prepare for zero-gravity conditions, as well as situations involving g-forces. Training for zero-gravity situations will happen in our state-of-the-art training pools, which use similar exercises and methods that astronauts have been using for years. Passengers will practice using their spacesuits and moving around in them, completing their training and officially making them astronauts.
